no.patternsolutions.javann
Class Counterpropagation

java.lang.Object
  no.patternsolutions.javann.Counterpropagation
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Counterpropagation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

By combining a Kohonen-layer with a Grossberg-layer, we get Counterpropagation. This version of couterpropagation (CP) is a standard CP. Standard CP means that the learn rates are constant during training, the hidden layer has just one winner and all weight- and input vectors are normalized.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

isDecreseLearnRateAEnabled

public boolean isDecreseLearnRateAEnabled()
Tells if the alpha learn rate shall decrese linear over the iterations. Default is false.

Returns:
true if the learn rate is decresing, false if not.
See Also:
setDecreseLearnRateA(boolean enabled)

isNormalized

public boolean isNormalized()
Tells if the input layer and the weights in the alpha layer shall be normalized. If the layers are normalized, the winner in the hidden Kohonen layer will have the maximum weighted sum of input. If not, the winner has the minimum euclidic distance to the input-vector.

Returns:
true if layers are normalized, false if not.
See Also:
Kohonen.setMatchType(boolean)

isDecreseLearnRateBEnabled

public boolean isDecreseLearnRateBEnabled()
Tells if the beta learn rate shall decrese linear over the iterations. Default is false.

Returns:
true if the learn rate is decresing, false if not.
See Also:
setDecreseLearnRateB(boolean enabled)

Returns:
the number of iterations in the Kohonen layer

getIterationsB

public int getIterationsB()
Returns the number of beta iterations used by trainPatters(...) when the network is trained i two steps.

the number of iterations in the Grossberg layer

getNeighbourRange

public double getNeighbourRange()
Gets the initial neighbour range. When the network is training, the distance between the winning node and all other nodes in the competing layer are measured. If this distance is less than the value given by the neighbour range, the node is updated. Default is 0.0.

Returns:
the neighbour range. This is usually a number between 0.0 and 1.0.

setNeighbourRange

public void setNeighbourRange(double neighbourRange)
Sets the initial neighbour range. When the network is training, the distance between the winning node and all other nodes in the competing layer are measured. If this distance is less than the value given by the neighbour range, the node is updated. Default is 0.0.

Parameters:
neighbourRange - the new neighbour range. This should be between 0.0 and 1.0.

setRandomUpdate

public void setRandomUpdate(boolean enabled)
Enables updating of the network randomly. If it's not randomly, it will be updated in sequental order.

Parameters:
enabled - true if random update shall be enabled, false if not.

setTwoStep

public void setTwoStep(boolean enabled)
Enables training in two steps. First the Kohonen layer will be trained with alpha learn rate and alpha iterations, then the Grossberg layer will be trained with beta learn rate and beta iterations. If two step is disabled, both the Kohonen and Grossberg layer will be trained within each iterations. Use setIterations(int) to set iterations when two step is not in use. Default is false.

Parameters:
enabled - true if two step training shall be enabled, false if not.

setNeighbourDecrease

public void setNeighbourDecrease(int constraint)
Specifies how the neighbor range is supposed to change. The three choises are:
  • Constant (no decreasing). Use "constant" or Kohonen.CONSTANT as parameter.
  • Linear decrease. Use "linear" or Kohonen.LINEAR_DECRESE as parameter.
  • Exponential decrease. Use "exponential" or Kohonen.EXPONENTIAL_DECRESE as parameter.

Parameters:
constraint - a String representing the method of changing the neighbor range.

setMatchType

public void setMatchType(boolean type)
Sets the type of method used to find a match node in the competing layer of the Kohonen network. If type is false, the match is the node that has the maximum weighted input. If type is true, the match node if the node that has the minimum euclidic distance to the input vector. It's possible to use the constants Kohonen.EUCLIDIC_DISTANCE and Kohonen.WEIGHTED_SUM as parameters.

Parameters:
type - the type of method used to find a match.

setDecreseLearnRateA

public void setDecreseLearnRateA(boolean enabled)
Enables linear decresing of the alpha learn rate over the iterations. Default is false.

Parameters:
enabled - true if the learn rate shall decrese, false if not.

setDecreseLearnRateB

public void setDecreseLearnRateB(boolean enabled)
Enables linear decresing of the beta learn rate over the iterations. Default is false.

Parameters:
enabled - true if the learn rate shall decrese, false if not.

setNormalized

public void setNormalized(boolean enabled)
Enables normalizing of input vector and alpha weights. Default is true.

Parameters:
enabled - true if the vectors shall be normalized, false if not.

setIterations

public void setIterations(int value)
Sets the number of iterations for the network to train a pattern. The default value is 500.

Parameters:
value - the number of iterations used by the next training of the network.
See Also:
trainPatterns(boolean[][], boolean[][])

setIterationsA

public void setIterationsA(int value)
Sets the number of iterations for the network to train a pattern. The default value is 30.

Parameters:
value - the number of alpha iterations used by the next training of the network.
See Also:
trainPatterns(boolean[][], boolean[][])

setIterationsB

public void setIterationsB(int value)
Sets the number of beta iterations for the network to train a pattern. The default value is 10.

Parameters:
value - the number of beta iterations used by the next training of the network.
See Also:
trainPatterns(boolean[][], boolean[][])

setWeightsInit

public void setWeightsInit(double value)
Sets the initial value of the weights to value. The weigts will get this value if the network is not yet trained or if reset() is runned.

Parameters:
value - the initial value of all the weights.
See Also:
reset()

randomizeWeights

public void randomizeWeights(double from,
                             double to)
Enables the weights to be initially set as random values between from and to. from <= X < to. Default is from 0.0 to 1.0.

Parameters:
from - minimum value of the weights
to - maximum value of the weights

getLearnRateA

public double getLearnRateA()
Returns the learn rate between the input layer and the hidden layer.

Returns:
the learn rate

getLearnRateB

public double getLearnRateB()
Returns the learn rate between the hidden layer and the output layer.

Returns:
the learn rate

getMatchType

public boolean getMatchType()
Tells if match is found by maximum weighted sum or minimum euclidic distance.

Returns:
false if maximum weighted sum is used.

getNeighbourRangeDecresse

public int getNeighbourRangeDecresse()
Tells how the neighbour range is changed or not changed during training. These different changes are "constant", "linear" or "exponential" decrese.

Returns:
either the String "constant", "linear" or "exponential".

setLearnRateA

public void setLearnRateA(double value)
Initiates the value of the alpha learn rate to value. Alpha learn rate is the rate of learning between the input layer and the hidden layer. Default is 0.5

Parameters:
value - the value of the learn rate.

setLearnRateB

public void setLearnRateB(double value)
Initiates the value of the beta learn rate to value. Beta learn rate is the rate of learning between the hidden layer and the output layer. Default is 0.3

Parameters:
value - the value of the learn rate.

                          int[][] answers)
Trains a set of patterns with a number of iterations. The number of iterations is set by setIterations(int).

Parameters:
inputs - a table of the input patterns.
answers - a table of the answers.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the network so that it's not trained. This will initiate the weights with eighter a random value or a fixed value.

See Also:
setWeightsInit(double), randomizeWeights(double,double)

run

public double[] run(double[] input)
Runs a pattern through the network and returns the output layer. If the input vector does not have the same length as specified in the constructor, this method will return a double table with length 0.

Parameters:
input - the input layer.
Returns:
the output layer.

Returns:
a table of output nodes.
